page.title: 04ATTITUDES
page.content: In many ways Abbotsham is the ideal village. It has a church, a chapel, a school, a pub, a post office and general stores. New housing has recently enlarged,without drastically changing,the centre of the village and is pleasant to look at. Most people questioned are very satisfied: "Abbotsham is a lovely place to live in" being the most frequent answer. By the efforts of parishioners, a playing field with a hard tarmac surface, is open all the year. Close by stands the Parish Hall administered by trustees. It has recently attracted a grant from the Community Council of Devon. It is in regular use by the Play group, the Women's Institute, Old time dancing, Skittles and a Youth club.
